reviews.text: This hotel is not a spa, fyi. It is however very comfortable and clean and big. It's in a pretty good location--near all the shops and restaurants. The train station is 5 minutes away. The front desk is friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice hotel. It's a 3-4 star hotel. The only problem I had is that there is no consierge--so making plans was difficult unless you knew exactly what to do. So, make sure you're prepared.

reviews.text: The hotel was clean, the breakfast was good, the staff were friendly but the view was not great. We overlooked a car park. If you just need an overnight stay then this is the place but I wouldn't recommend it for a holiday. Montecatini Terme in my opinion is just not a nice place. If you want to stay in the area go to montecatini Alto....it's beautiful!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ended up in this hotel after we could not find any hotels in Florence. Our driving experience in Florence was a definitely one to remember. Montecatini Terme is a small town with a hill town called Montecatini Alto. This town has a "billion" hotels quoting a local and to be true I don't think he's that far off. The Tuscany Inn in a clean and new/modern looking hotel with great service and what I think is a very fair rate (80 euros for us). Room is great but the bed is a little hard and they charge for the internet. Although I think the internet should be free, we've looked in a couple other hotels in town before this one and they had no internet for the same price and they looked alot older. We actually ended up coming back to this hotel a second night after a day trip to Florence using the train (about 7 euros return trip for 45min). We highly recommend them.
reviews.title: A gem we found by sheer luck

reviews.title: Montecatini Terme - Heart of Tuscany

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from 6 nights 10/7/10. The Hotel is tucked off a side street that added a hour to our first day trying to find it. First the positive. Modern Hotel with A/C. Underground parking lot included in price. Dinner in hotel was good and a deal at 15 euro each. Front desk staff helpful . Plenty of hot water and a good firm bed. Internet available in the lobby for 3 euro for 30 min. The negative , Hotel overlooks the train tracks which brings bells and whistles at all hours. The hotel is 7 years old but looks twice that. Well worn and dirty in places. Housekeeping spotty, Missing towels on two occasions and unable to get a second pillow. Breakfast is something out right out of faulty towers less the warldorf salad. We went once and didn't go back. The area although very safe , did have ladies of the night working at the end of the block by the railroad crossing. All in all it did the trick but more like a quality inn than a real Tuscan experience.
reviews.title: Value Package

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the Tuscany Inn very much, Montecatini-Termi is a great central location for all points Tuscany whether you have a car or would use the train. Day trips can readily be reached to go as far as Cinque Terre to the northwest or Siena to the south and Florence is easily reached by train 40 mins. east. No need to drive...train drops you right at the main staition w/in walking distance to the Duomo, etc. And, M-Terme is not to be unnoticed for its own historical spa venues and a short trip to go to M/catini-Alte to see an expansive panora or Tuscany likely unrivaled from any other points. A 360 degree panorama.
reviews.title: Young staff, helpful, friendly asset to the hotel which make it wothwhile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a week in October 2009. It was included in a great trip we booked through Gate1 travel which was a great deal. The hotel was modern, clean, included free parking, and had an amazingly helpful staff. The lovely town of Montecatini was within walking distance as was a supermarket. Breakfast every morning was included and the restaurant also served an affordable price fixe dinner that we took advantage of on our first night. We were very pleased.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for the Price

reviews.text: The rooms were simple and clean and had particularly good showers. It was conveniently located to the center of this small town as well as to exits from the city making it easy to get to other spots in Tuscany. The front desk staff was young and enthusiastic and routinely went out of their way to suggest spots in Tuscany that we might like. Not only did they suggest and compare, but they ran off MapQwest maps for our aid. That alone made it worthwhile and a place I would highly recommend for a tourist hotel. Not fancy, but it had everything you could need with the exception of internet access.
